description: Add Only Flag.  Indicates that the service is an add only, not an update.

Payroll_InputObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Payroll_InputObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Payroll_InputObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: Unique identifier for an External Payroll Input entry

External_Payroll_Input_Data.description: The integration ID used to reference the Payroll Input.  If the ID for the Payroll Input is found, the web service will update the existing data.  Otherwise, a new Payroll Input instance  will be created.

External_Payroll_Input_Data.description: Unique identifier used to reference a Pay Component (e.g. Earning, Deduction)
A non-unique code used by some Payroll Interface customers.  External Payroll Code is available in Workday 13 if the customer has enabled it via the Tenant Setup page.

Batch ID can be assigned to a set of Payroll Inputs to enable the external system to manage Payroll Input data by Batch ID.  There are transactions in Workday Payroll that let the user maintain Payroll Input data by Batch ID (Payroll Input by Batch ID and Delete Payroll Input by Batch ID).
Start Date (e.g. the date on which the Payroll Input commences)
End Date (e.g. the date on which the Payroll Input ends, if applicable)

description: Contains each External Payroll Input based on the Request Criteria.  The data returned is the current information as of the dates in the response filter.

validation.validation: Pay Calculation (Earning, Deduction, or a Related Calculation) must allow input.
validation.description: Pay Calculation (Earning, Deduction, or a Related Calculation) must allow input.

validation.validation: Payroll Input may only contain a Goal Amount when the Payroll Input Types associated with the Pay Component include Goal Amount.
validation.description: Payroll Input may only contain a Goal Amount when the Payroll Input Types associated with the Pay Component include Goal Amount.

validation.validation: Payroll Input may only contain an Adjustment Value when the Payroll Input Types associated with the Pay Component include Adjustment.
validation.description: Payroll Input may only contain an Adjustment Value when the Payroll Input Types associated with the Pay Component include Adjustment.

validation.validation: Payroll Input cannot contain a Goal Amount when an Adjustment Value has been entered.
validation.description: Payroll Input cannot contain a Goal Amount when an Adjustment Value has been entered.

validation.validation: The End Date must be greater than the Start Date.
validation.description: The End Date must be greater than the Start Date.

validation.validation: Overlapping Input Line: for input lines that pertain to the same Earning/Deduction and are non-adjustments, there can not be an overlap in Start and End Dates (Note: no value for End Date assumes an on-going Payroll Input)
validation.description: Overlapping Input Line: for input lines that pertain to the same Earning/Deduction and are non-adjustments, there can not be an overlap in Start and End Dates (Note: no value for End Date assumes an on-going Payroll Input)

validation.validation: Duplicate Input Line: for input lines that are non-adjustments, there can only be a maximum of 1 line with the combination of Earning/Deduction, Start Date and End Date.
validation.description: Duplicate Input Line: for input lines that are non-adjustments, there can only be a maximum of 1 line with the combination of Earning/Deduction, Start Date and End Date.

validation.validation: Payroll Input may only contain either Amount Value or Adjustment Value, but not a value for both.
validation.description: Payroll Input may only contain either Amount Value or Adjustment Value, but not a value for both.

validation.validation: Batch ID is already associated with other types of Application Batches.
Position should not be entered if pay component is not position based.
Position is required if pay component is position based.
Position reference cannot be entered because multiple jobs are not enabled in this tenant.
Worker's primary position must be in a payroll interface pay group if position is not supplied on the external payroll input.
validation.description: Worker's primary position must be in a payroll interface pay group if position is not supplied on the external payroll input.

validation.validation: Previously added Pay Component for Payroll Input cannot be subsequently changed. [worker]
Changing the worker associated with a Payroll Input is not allowed when updating an existing Payroll Input. [worker]
Start Date must be greater than or equal to [validationDate]
End Date must be greater than or equal to [validationDate]
Enter an End Date for the terminated employee's ongoing Payroll Input.
validation.description: Enter an End Date for the terminated employee's ongoing Payroll Input.

validation.validation: Enter an End Date for the ended position's ongoing Payroll Input.
validation.description: Enter an End Date for the ended position's ongoing Payroll Input.

validation.validation: Start date must be equal to or greater than position start date.
validation.description: Start date must be equal to or greater than position start date.

validation.validation: End Date must be the same as the Start Date for an adjustment only input.
validation.description: End Date must be the same as the Start Date for an adjustment only input.

validation.validation: For adjustment entry enter an End Date that is the same as the start date.
validation.description: For adjustment entry enter an End Date that is the same as the start date.
